article_title: Sens. Say HHS Ignored ACA Co-Op Program Red Flags
article_text:
Sens. Say HHS Ignored ACA Co-Op Program Red Flags

Law360, New York (March 15, 2016, 8:09 PM ET) -- The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services knew that the Affordable Care Act’s co-op program was providing billions of dollars to financially weak insurers but continued to approve loans and failed to enhance oversight, according to a U.S. Senate subcommittee majority report published Thursday



A report by the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs’ Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations said a Deloitte Consulting LLP evaluation had alerted HHS early on to the failures of the consumer-governed nonprofit insurers, half of which have now failed. The Patient...

To view the full article, register now.

Say HHS Ignored ACA Co-Op Program Red FlagsLaw360, New York (March 15, 2016, 8:09 PM ET) -- The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services knew that the Affordable Care Act’s co-op program was providing billions of dollars to financially weak insurers but continued to approve loans and failed to enhance oversight, according to a U.S. Senate subcommittee majority report published ThursdayA report by the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs’ Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations said a Deloitte Consulting LLP evaluation had alerted HHS early on to the failures of the consumer-governed nonprofit insurers, half of which have now failed.
